sections.title: Personal Information
fields: Finnish (mother tongue), English (fluent in conversation and writing, including IT terminology)
Hydroponics, photography, cosmology, theoretical physics, Arduinos, network security, operating systems, hardware diagnostics, server administration and programming

sections.title: Summary
largeList: Self-taught IT generalist with experience of working in all fields of software development, including architecture design, development, optimization, debugging, documentation, testing, maintenance, and customer support.
Long history in *nix server set up and administration for various purposes, including securing servers.
Reliable professional, open for innovation, able to handle stressful projects with deadlines and ad-hoc situations.
Started doing everything related to computers at a young age, having used 20+ programming/scripting languages and 10+ operating systems, NOT including all variants and different distributions.
Fast at learning new things, always looking to improve on tools currently in use, good endurance for keeping at it when working with difficult problems.
Most important things at work are that it must be challenging enough, it must be something that one can be proud of, and there must be ample opportunity to learn new things.
Elected to be health and safety representative (ty√∂suojeluvaltuutettu) in Nord Software and Pryte.

sections.title: Experience Summary
largeList: Long history at LAMP (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP) development, lately focused on DevOps things and switched to mainly programming in Python and some JavaScript (Node.js).

Solid knowledge in database structure design gained through experience in making database intensive software and lectures by MySQL consultants. Debugging performance issues, optimization through means such as proper use of indexes and using temporary tables, keeping of historical data for logging purposes, and tuning configuration.

Great experience in optimization of web-based software used world-wide, with up to 800 000 visits per day. This includes use of caching technologies (such as Memcached), caching servers (Varnish), and optimizations of multiple different layers.
History of managing larger environments (dozens of servers) and ensuring high availability and scalability using various means.

Experienced in agile software development methodologies (including Scrum), server administration tasks (including debugging performance and configuration issues), automation (incl. continuous integration and delivery systems), as well as automated testing.

Linux (CentOS, Debian/Ubuntu, many more), FreeBSD, OpenBSD, Windows (not for server use)

MySQL, MongoDB, Cassandra, Redis, Riak, memcache, Sphinx, SOLR
nmap, Nessus, AIDE, rkhunter, chkrootkit, snort, iptables, pf
IPSec (racoon, openswan), OpenVPN, tcpdump, Wireshark, TCP tuning
Amazon Web Services (EC2, VPC, RDS, S3, Route 53, SES, ...), Nginx, Apache, varnish, Zabbix, Splunk, Git, Mercurial, SVN

sections.title: Pryte (DevOps Lead)
sections.large:
At Pryte I took over managing the infrastructure (mostly AWS), continuous integration and delivery systems, and ensuring infrastructure security.

While writing Chef recipes for various purposes, I worked to improve the recipe collection, introducing testing and quality management tools (Vagrant, foodcritic) and taking into use common best practices.

I wrote lots of custom tools, e.g.:

  • Bootstrapping new servers
  • Launching complete staging environments on demand (AWS EC2)
  • Managing infrastructure-wide strict firewall automatically based on mix of a configuration file and automatic server detection via Chef searches
  • Automatic backups of critical servers
  • Doing server healthchecks
  • Collecting monitoring data with adapters to different systems (CopperEgg and Zabbix)

    • I also wrote the background task queue system responsible e.g. for signing APKs.

    I was also involved in designing system architecture and features.

sections.title: Kiosked (Senior Software Engineer)
sections.large:
At Kiosked I worked on a wide variety of things, some of them being:

  • The functionalities responsible for importing millions of products and then choosing the best matches to show for end users.
  • Implementing many improvements to the core systems and important tools for developers.
  • Profiling and optimizing the application core and servers, including implementation of custom tools for profiling and debugging.
  • Actively introducing new technologies to the system and developers.

I also was a part of the 24/7 on call team making sure the systems were up and running always.

sections.title: Nord Software (Senior Software Engineer)
sections.large:
In addition to the previous responsibilities as a software engineer, I was given responsibility of leading or supervising several development teams. I also participated in regular discussions about how to improve things in the company, ranging from employee happiness in general, to taking new technologies in use.

I have participated in some way in most projects at Nord Software, sometimes just for quick technical consultancy in design or to resolve issues, sometimes I was a one-man project team.

I also took care of some common tasks around the office, such as making sure more sodas are ordered in time to keep the programmers well hydrated.

sections.title: Nord Software (Software Engineer)
sections.large:
I have had a wide array of responsibilities at Nord Software. These have included integrating secure communications to payment gateways, profiling and optimizing lots of software projects, choosing the appropriate hardware and software stacks, software and database architecture design, customer contact and project planning.

Server configuration choosing as well as communicating with the hosting partners to pick the various software stacks has also been one of the tasks most commonly assigned to me.

Some keywords: Web application development, database design, MySQL query & server optimization, LAMP stack optimization, software optimization, server administration, PHP, JavaScript, C++, HTML, CSS, Linux, Apache, MySQL, Nginx, Varnish, Memcache, etc.

sections.title: Case DI
fields: Bash Shell, JavaScript, MySQL, PHP, Bootstrap, Drupal
Senior software engineer, database and software architecture designer, integrations
sections.large: Case DI is an employee portal for highly qualified professionals. The portal included SOAP integration with an application for keeping information of available jobs and applying for them, as well as creating a SOAP authentication API for communication with another application.

sections.title: Case W
fields: Bash Shell, JavaScript, MySQL, PHP, LDAP, Bootstrap, Yii
Senior software engineer, database and software architecture designer, core component developer
sections.large:
Case W is a work shift planning and scheduling system with LDAP integration. The application can be used to first plan requirements for staffing in different teams at different times, and those requirements can easily be used to plan each employee's weekly schedules. Employees can also use the application to request vacation, track their vacation day usage, notify the team managers about sick leave, and request to switch shifts with other employees.

The software scales well from the needs of a small team to the needs of a company with hundreds of employees. The system is also highly customizable and features a custom-built JavaScript application structure and several larger JavaScript-driven UI components used for planning the weekly and daily schedules.

sections.title: Case L
fields: Team lead, database and software architecture designer, project manager
Development, database design, software and server optimization, core components, payment systems, customer contact
sections.large:
Case L was an online e-commerce site, that was given a full frontend rewrite, while only doing some improvements on the already existing backend software. The frontend was given a much more modern responsive layout, with several interactive JavaScript components, while trying to keep a familiar and comfortable feel to the site for the existing customers.

An easy to integrate and extensible payment system module was done for the project, so future projects can benefit from it as well.

sections.title: Case D
sections.large:
Case D was a multi-threaded C++ application created to handle time-critical actions on a high-traffic site that needs to deliver real-time data to all of their clients. The application was built from scratch, fully customized to the needs of the client, with focus on stability, performance, scalability and readability of the code. The application is capable of automatically recovering even from many severe errors without affecting the site, it is easy to debug and profile, and scales easily by sharding and includes a simple high availability implementation.

Case D was handled as a one-man project, for both customer contact and technical implementation.

sections.title: Case B
fields: Large LAMP environment, Memcached, MongoDB, Varnish, nginx
Bash Shell, C++, JavaScript, MySQL, PHP
Team lead, senior software engineer, database and software architecture designer
Development, database design, software and server optimization, and security auditing
sections.large:
Case B was creating a world-wide high profile internet based site, with real-time data and payment system integrations from scratch. The servers, software and database were heavily optimized to serve a large amount of clicks per day, while still keeping the data real-time. Several different payment systems were integrated, and several security systems were created to ensure transaction integrity. The database was also been designed to keep the system robust, while making sure that all data was preserved.

Case B served up to 800 000 visitors and a few million page views per day.

sections.title: Case M
fields: Large LAMP environment, Memcached, MongoDB, Varnish, nginx
Team lead, software engineer, database and software architecture designer, customer support
Development, database design, architecture design, optimization, and customer support
sections.large: Case M was a web-based marketing management tool. With the application, large organizations are able to manage, organize and supervise their marketing investments on all organizational levels and business activities. The application uses pdflib to generate PDF reports with graphs.

sections.title: Case S
fields: Software engineer, architecture designer, customer support
Development, database design, architecture design, and optimization
sections.large: Case S was an online consumer behavior surveying application. It enables creation and fielding of multimedia-enriched surveys. The application is designed to run on all browsers all the way back to IE6. The surveys are completely executed client side, in the browser, to reduce the server load. A communication framework relays the gathered data to the server side IO API.

sections.title: PHP Framework
sections.large:
PHP Framework was at one time the base used for most of Nord Software's PHP projects. This system was been built for performance and rapid application development.

Eventually the PHP framework was retired and replaced in most projects with the Yii PHP Framework.

sections.title: Case E
sections.large: Case E was a tool for measuring, planning and managing the corporate relationships in companies working in a project-based or business-to-business environment. The software used a wide variety of technologies, for example pdflib to generate extensive PDF reports with graphs, and SOAP to communicate and transmit collected data to Salesforce.

sections.title: JSIS
sections.large:
JSIS is short for JavaScript IRC Stats. It is a tool to generate statistics from Internet Relay Chat log files. The tool was built due to frustration with existing tools and to have fun while learning Node.js.

The tool is well documented, and the code is structured so adding support for more log file formats, new statistical widgets, and themes is easy.
